contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated with an active verb. This is a command. By commanding that the waters gather together, God made them gather together. Alternate translation: "Let the waters ... gather" or "Let the waters ... come together" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-imperative]])
contextId.glQuote: Let the waters ... be gathered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God had finished creating them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: were finished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "there was no companion that was right for him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: there was found no helper suitable for him

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "curse" comes first in the sentence to emphasize that the ground, which had been "good" ([Genesis 1:10](../01/10.md)), was now under God's curse. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I am cursing the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: cursed is the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will not allow him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he must not be allowed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I am cursing you so that you will not be able to grow food from the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Now cursed are you from the ground

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will take vengeance on him seven times" or "I will punish that person seven times as severely as I am punishing you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: vengeance will be taken on him sevenfold

contextId.occurrenceNote: Lamech knows that God will avenge Cain seven times. Alternate translation: "Since God will punish anyone who kills Cain seven times, Lamech" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If Cain is avenged seven times, then Lamech

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whoever kills me, God will punish seventy-seven times" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: then Lamech will be avenged seventy-seven times

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be made active. Alternate translation: "when he created them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when they were created

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be active. Alternate translation: "the women bore daughters" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: daughters were born to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: If necessary, this can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So every living thing ... perished" or "So the flood completely destroyed every living thing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So every living thing ... was wiped out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God destroyed them all" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were all destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: "The water stopped coming out of the ground and the rain stopped falling." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God closed the fountains of the deep and the windows of heaven" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The fountains of the deep and the windows of heaven were closed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until the wind dried up the waters" or "until the waters dried up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until the waters were dried up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the waters covering the earth dried up" or "the wind dried up the waters covering the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the waters were dried up from off the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is not clear who will see the rainbow, but because the covenant is between Yahweh and people, if you need to say who it is who will see the rainbow, it would be best to name both Yahweh and people. This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "people and I see the rainbow" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the rainbow is seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be made active. Alternate translation: "the people of the earth divided themselves" or "the people of the earth separated from one another" or "God divided the people of the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the earth was divided

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "we will separate from each other and live in different places" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we will be scattered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be made active. Alternate translation: "I will bless all the families of the earth through you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Through you will all the families of the earth be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that, because of you, they will not kill me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that my life will be spared because of you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Pharaoh took her into his household" or "Pharaoh had his soldiers take her into his household" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the woman was taken into Pharaoh's household

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May God Most High, the Creator of heaven and earth, bless Abram" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Blessed be Abram by God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the owners of that land will enslave your descendants and oppress them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be enslaved and oppressed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be active. Alternate translation: "she hated me" or "she began to hate me" or "she thought she was better than me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I was despised in her eyes

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in an active form. Alternate translation: "You must circumcise every male among you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Every male among you must be circumcised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to slaves. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "any male that you buy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: him who is bought with money

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will mark my covenant in your flesh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: my covenant will be in your flesh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form, and you may leave out words that will give wrong meaning in your language. Alternate translation: "male whom you have not circumcised" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: uncircumcised male who is not circumcised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom he had bought" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those bought

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Let me bring you some water" or "My servant will bring you some water" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Let a little water be brought

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will bless all the nations of the earth through Abraham" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the nations of the earth will be blessed in him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active from. Alternate translation: "you should treat the righteous the same way you treat the wicked" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the righteous should be treated the same as the wicked

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. You may have to fill in the ellipsis, "righteous people." Alternate translation: "if you find forty righteous people there" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: if there are forty found there

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. You may have to fill in the ellipsis, "righteous people." Alternate translation: "you will find thirty righteous people there" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: thirty will be found there

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. You may have to fill in the ellipsis, "righteous people." Alternate translation: "you will find twenty righteous people there" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: twenty will be found there

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so Yahweh does not also destroy you when he punishes the people of this city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you are not swept away in the punishment of the city

contextId.occurrenceNote: The passive phrase "made right" can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "everyone will know that you are innocent" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: before everyone, you are completely made right

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "will be named" means those born through Isaac are the ones God considers to be the descendants that he promised Abraham. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Isaac is the one who will be the forefather of the descendants I promised to give you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it is through Isaac that your descendants will be named

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "was a ram whose horns were stuck in the bushes" or "was a ram stuck in the bushes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was a ram caught in the bushes by his horns

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he will provide" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be provided

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I, the Lord, will bless all the people living everywhere" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the nations of the earth will be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone told Abraham" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Abraham was told

contextId.occurrenceNote: It is not clear who did this work. This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Laban's servants unloaded the camels" or "the camels were unloaded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he unloaded the camels

contextId.occurrenceNote: This does not say who did the work. If you state this in active form use "Laban's servants" as the subject. Alternate translation: "Laban's servants gave straw and feed to the camels, and they provided water" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The camels were given straw and feed, and water was provided

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So Rebekah comforted Isaac" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: So Isaac was comforted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They buried Abraham" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Abraham was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will bless all the nations of the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the nations of the earth will be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: Abimelech may have intended to tell someone to kill anyone who might harm Isaac or Rebekah. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will put him to death" or "I will order my men to kill him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will surely be put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh has blessed you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you are blessed by Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May God curse everyone who curses you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May every one who curses you be cursed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May God bless everyone who blesses you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may every one who blesses you be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone told Rebekah about Esau's plan" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The words of Esau her older son were told to Rebekah

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will bless all families on the earth through you and your descendants" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Through you and through your descendants will all the families of the earth be blessed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for you to gather the flocks" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for the flocks to be gathered together

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until the other shepherds gather their flocks" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until all the flocks are gathered together

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "have been completed" can be stated in active form. The statement is emphatic. Alternate translation: Give me my wife, so that I may marry her, for I have completed the length of time that I was to work for you!"Give me Rachel so that I may marry her, for I have worked seven years for you!" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Give me my wife, for my days have been completedâ€”so that I may marry her!

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jacob did not love Leah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Leah was not loved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh has heard that my husband does not love me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh has heard that I am unloved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If you find any goats without spots or any sheep that are not black, you can consider them stolen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Every one that is not speckled and spotted among the goats, and black among the sheep, if any are found with me, will be considered to be stolen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone told Laban" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Laban was told

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When a wild animal killed one of your animals I did not bring it to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: What was torn by beasts I did not bring to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: The abstract nouns "faithfulness" and "trustworthiness" can be stated as "faithful" and "loyal." Alternate translation: "I do not deserve for you to remain faithful to your covenant or for you to be loyal to me, your servant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I am not worthy of all your acts of covenant faithfulness and of all the trustworthiness that you have done for your servant

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which no one can count because of their number" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: which cannot be numbered for their number

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The man injured Jacob's hip as he wrestled with him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Jacob's hip was dislocated as he wrestled with him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "yet he spared my life" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: and my life is delivered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that my servants brought to you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was brought to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If we force them to go too fast even for one day" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If they are driven hard even one day

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for he should not have done such a terrible thing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for such a thing should not have been done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "So Hamor and Shechem had someone circumcise all the men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Every male was circumcised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they will destroy me" or "they will destroy us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: then I will be destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They buried her down from Bethel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: She was buried down from Bethel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but your name will no longer be Jacob" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but your name will no longer be called Jacob

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they buried her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: Jacob thinks that a wild animal has torn Joseph's body apart. Alternate translation: "It has certainly torn Joseph to pieces" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Joseph has certainly been torn to pieces

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but he would not let them comfort him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but he refused to be comforted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be written in active form. Alternate translation: "His father named him Er" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He was named Er

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone told Tamar" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Tamar was told

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Judah had not given her to Shelah as a wife" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she had not been given to him as a wife

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he caused her to become pregnant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she became pregnant by him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "take back the pledge"(See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: receive the pledge

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone told Judah" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it was told to Judah

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "it" refers to the "prostitution" that she committed. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it has made her pregnant" or "she is pregnant" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: she is pregnant by it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "we will burn her to death" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let her be burned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When they brought her out" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When she was brought out

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "she named him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was named

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the place where the king put his prisoners" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the place where the king's prisoners were confined

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "This was the same prison that Joseph was in" or "This was the same prison Potiphar put Joseph in" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: in the same prison where Joseph was confined

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For indeed people took me" or "For indeed the Ishmaelites took me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For indeed I was abducted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that were thin and burned because of the hot wind from the east" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: thin and scorched by the east wind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one would have been able to tell that the thin cows had eaten the fat cows" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it could not be known that they had eaten them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "seven thin heads of grain scorched because of the hot wind from the east" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: seven thin heads scorched by the east wind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God gave you two dreams to show you that he will certainly cause these things to happen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: That the dream was repeated to Pharaoh is because the matter has been established by God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will rule over my people and they will do what you command" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: according to your word will all my people be ruled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "This is how I will test you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: By this you will be tested

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that I may find out if you are telling the truth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that your words may be tested, whether there is truth in you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "leave one of your brothers here in prison" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let one of your brothers be confined in this prison

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so I may know what you say is true" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so your words will be verified

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The servants did for them everything that Joseph commanded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It was done for them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone has put my money back" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: My money has been put back

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they were going into Joseph's house" or "the steward was taking them into Joseph's house" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they were brought to Joseph's house

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The steward is bringing us into the house because of the money that someone put back in our sacks" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is because of the money that was returned in our sacks the first time we were brought in

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they sent the men away, along with their donkeys" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the men were sent away, they and their donkeys

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If I find the cup in one of your sacks, that person will be my slave" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He with whom the cup is found will be my slave

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated as a new sentence and in active form. Alternate translation: "youngest. The steward found the cup in Benjamin's sack" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: youngest, and the cup was found in Benjamin's sack

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "a wild animal has torn him to pieces" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he is torn in pieces

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. You may also need to add the words "to tell them," which the writer left out of this ellipsis. Alternate translation: "I also command you to tell them" or "also tell them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: you are commanded

contextId.occurrenceNote: An "allowance" is an amount of money or food that someone regularly gives to another person. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Pharaoh gave the priests a certain amount of food each day" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the priests were given an allowance

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When someone told Jacob" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When Jacob was told

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they placed him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was placed
